primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The God of the Gospel intervenes in human history to transform death/chaos into life/order through a series of historical and ontological acts (Creation, Exodus, Covenant, Resurrection).

tekstueel_bewijs: God can probe into our deepest negations
This God has been taking our dismal modes of chaos
God heard their cry... and came down to deliver them
new space for life, new energy for obedience
so that people can sing and dance in freedom
God will engraft God’s Torah into their hearts
God’s readiness for us in Christ

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal sin but systemic 'deathly systems' and 'primordial chaos' that require a divine subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the new life: relinquishing old assumptions and practicing solidarity.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Disciple/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as a 'resonance' or 'result' of the primary divine action.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Fidelity → New Life → The People

voorbeelden_god_subject: God abruptly broke the despairing silence
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can line out the move
we must die to many old assumptions

voorbeelden: we must die to many old assumptions
they wanted no part of it
I do not need to tell you
God can probe into our deepest negations
You will be able to count on my promise

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Power-to-do' (Pouvoir) which creates a new 'Ability-to-do' in the human subject. It is an endowment of competence rather than a mere demand.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Chaos/Empire) to S1 (New Life) via the negation of S2 (Forgiveness/Breaking the cycle).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God breaks the cycle of S2 through a 'plunge into self-giving', making S1 possible.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death and empire are treated as formidable powers.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the primary actor. Human action is framed as a 'resonance' or 'result' of divine initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Give it up. Lose that old life.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: This God makes a way out of no way!
This God holds no grudge. This God keeps no score.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Abraham, Sarah, Slaves) are used as recipients of God's action, not as moral models for the hearer to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who gives the child to the barren couple.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the burden of 'newness' is on God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's act (Soteriology) to the neighborhood (Ethics) is logically linked via the metaphor of 'inhaling' the Torah.
spanning_punten: The shift from God's 'self-giving' to our 'inconvenient obedience' creates a slight modal tension.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: death had no power over God’s will for life... causing exploitative systems to collapse

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Torah is 'engrafted' and 'inhaled', changing the subject's competence from within.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as an 'imperial system' and 'chaos' that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is narratively robust with God as the Subject. It avoids the 'Helper-God' trap.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the hearer as the 'Receiver' of the 'Newness'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Integrate more Vouloir (Desire) to bridge the gap to the ethical section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how God's forgiveness specifically awakens the 'wanting' to serve the neighbor.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (God acts -> We resonate) is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the Gospel narrative while moving toward concrete social ethics.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'B' alliteration; Greimas shows that the 'B' section functions as a modal change in the Subject's competence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Jeremiah's context; Greimas explains how the 'New Covenant' functions as a narrative engine for the hearer's identity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'neighbor' is the Receiver of the Secondary Program, while the Hearer is the Subject, but only because God (Sender) changed the Hearer's nature.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (brings, probes, creates, heard, saw, came down, delivers, speaks, breaks, will make, will establish, will engraft, holds no grudge, intends to break)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids 'if-then' conditionality, maintaining a 'because-therefore' grace structure.
